head.title: Metro Business; An Auction Hiatus For a Wine Seller

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; An Auction Hiatus For a Wine Seller

abstract.p: Sherry-Lehmann, wine merchant, decides to put off re-entry into auction world for 'year or two' (S)

block.p: After seven months of deliberating, Sherry-Lehmann, the East Side wine merchant, has decided to put off re-entry into the auction world for ''a year or two.''
Michael Aaron, its chairman, said yesterday that when Sherry-Lehmann resumed its sales of fine and rare wine at auction, it would do so independently and online.
After seven months of deliberating, Sherry-Lehmann, the East Side wine merchant, has decided to put off re-entry into the auction world for ''a year or two.''
Michael Aaron, its chairman, said yesterday that when Sherry-Lehmann resumed its sales of fine and rare wine at auction, it would do so independently and online.

Mr. Aaron attributed the delay to significant improvements in the store's retail business, especially online. ''Within a couple of years, most wine auctions are really going to be online, not brick-and-mortar,'' he said, adding that he expected the cost of online auctions and the technology to improve in a year or two.
Sherry-Lehmann's partnership with Sotheby's ended last November.
